segment.source: To deploy a Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 image to multiple computers, you must first prepare the image for deployment.
segment.target: To deploy a Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 image to multiple computers, you must first prepare the image for deployment.

segment.source: This section provides information about the steps that are required to prepare a MED-V image for deployment.
segment.target: This section provides information about the steps that are required to prepare a MED-V image for deployment.

segment.source: Creating a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V
segment.target: Creating a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V

segment.source: Describes how to create and configure a Windows Virtual PC image for MED-V.
segment.target: Describes how to create and configure a Windows Virtual PC image for MED-V.

segment.source: This includes installing Windows XP on the image with the required updates and integration components.
segment.target: This includes installing Windows XP on the image with the required updates and integration components.

segment.source: Installing Applications on a Windows Virtual PC Image
segment.target: Installing Applications on a Windows Virtual PC Image

segment.source: Describes the process of installing applications on your MED-V image.
segment.target: Describes the process of installing applications on your MED-V image.

segment.source: Configuring a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V
segment.target: Configuring a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V

segment.source: Describes how to configure and package a Windows Virtual PC image for MED-V by using Sysprep.
segment.target: Describes how to configure and package a Windows Virtual PC image for MED-V by using Sysprep.
